interface.name: liri_shell
interface.description: This interface is bound by a special client called shell helper that is responsible for helping the compositor draw its user interface. It can only be bound once and only shell helper is allowed.

request.name: set_grab_surface
request.description: The surface set by this request will receive a fake pointer.enter event at position 0, 0 and is expected to set an appropriate cursor image every time the grab_cursor event is sent by the compositor.

event.name: grab_cursor

description.summary: tell client what cursor to show during a grab

event.description: This event will be sent immediately before a fake enter event on the grab surface.

request.name: bind_shortcut

description.summary: register a shortcut with the compositor

request.description: The client calls this request to register a shortcut with the compositor. This will create a liri_shortcut object that will emit the activated event.

request.name: ready
request.description: Tell the compositor that the shell has created all the layer surfaces and it can hide the splash screen revealing the desktop.

request.name: terminate
request.description: Ask the compositor to quit. This is usually called from the logout dialog.

event.name: shutdown_requested
event.description: When the power off or suspend button is pressed, the compositor will throw this event and the client will show the shutdown dialog.

event.name: quit
event.description: During the shutdown, the compositor emits this event in order to let the client exit cleanly.

interface.name: liri_shortcut
interface.description: The activated event is emitted every time this shortcut is activated by the compositor.

description.summary: tell the client the shortcut was triggered

interface.name: liri_osd
interface.description: With this interface, the compositor asks the client to display either a text or a progress inside the on-screen display surface.

event.name: text
event.description: Show an icon with text on screen.

event.name: progress
event.description: Show an icon with a progress bar on screen. The value can be an integer number from 0 to 100.
